intro: Hydrocotyle callicephala, commonly known as the smooth marsh mallow, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Araliaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a fine, velvety hair. The plant produces small, white flowers with five petals, which bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as wetlands and stream banks. Hydrocotyle callicephala is often found in temperate regions of the Americas and is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic habitats.
